seriesJson.title: The wandering ballad singer
seriesJson.description: Folk music series hosted by musician Barre Toelken, who collects folk songs and has worked as a dance band musician, a Forest Service employee, and prospector.

node.title: Odds and ends
node.description: In this program, "Odds and Ends," Barre Toelken analyzes and performs various folk songs and ballads that don't fit the themes of other programs in the series.

node.title: Sea songs
node.description: In this program, Barre Toelken analyzes and performes several sea songs.

node.title: Railroad songs and ballads
node.description: In this program, Barre Toelken analyzes and performs various railroad songs and ballads.

node.title: Love songs
node.description: In this program, Barre Tolken analyzes and performs various love songs from the folk idiom.

node.title: Around the world
node.description: This program includes more ballads collected from various parts of the world.

node.title: Wide world singers
node.description: In this program, Barre Toelken explores and perform various ballads from around the world

node.title: More wide world singers
node.description: In this program, Barre Toelken continues to explore and perform various ballads from around the world

node.title: Chain gang and work songs
node.description: In this program, Barre Toelken analyzes and performs various chain gang and work songs.

node.title: Blues
node.description: In this program, Barre Toelken analyzes and performs several blues songs.

node.title: Bums and vagrants
node.description: This program takes a look at some of the folk music created by and for homeless and itinerant people.

node.title: Mormon songs
node.description: This program takes a look at some of the folk music created by and for the Mormon community.

node.title: Nonsense songs
node.description: In this program, Barre Toelken focuses on "Nonsense Songs," folk songs with silly, nonsensical lyrics.

node.title: Songs of loggers and miners
node.description: This program takes a look at some of the folk music created by and for miners and loggers.

node.title: Songs of the cowboys
node.description: This program takes a look at some of the folk music created by and for the cowboys of the American west.

node.title: Songs of the settlers
node.description: This program takes a look at some of the folk music created by and for American settlers.

node.title: Tragic hero in balladry
node.description: This program explores the motif of the tragic hero in balladry.

node.title: Early American folk songs
node.description: This program explores early American folk songs.

node.title: Tough men
node.description: This program explores folk songs around the theme of "Tough Men."

node.title: Riddle ballads
node.description: This program explores ballads that include riddles and symbolism.

node.title: Bad women
node.description: This program explores folk songs around the theme of "Bad Women."

node.title: Ballads in transition
node.description: This program explores the ways that ballads changed as they made their way to different places.

node.title: English ballads, American versions
node.description: This program explores American versions of Engilsh ballads.

node.title: English ballads III
node.description: In this program, "English Ballads III," Barre Toelken plays a variety of death-themed ballads.

node.title: English ballads IV
node.description: In this program, "English Ballads IV," Barre Toelken plays a variety of infidelity-themed ballads.

node.title: English ballads I
node.description: In this program, Barre Toelken explores the history of English ballads.

node.title: English ballads II
node.description: In this program, Barre Toelken continues to explore the history of English ballads.
